results.title: Koalas and lyre birds
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Two in the Bush”.
The naturalist and author, Gerald Durrell, watches koala being caught and transferred from one reserve to another to save them from starvation. We also see lyrebirds in Sherbrooke Forest and visit a wild life sanctuary on the Gold Coast of Queensland.

results.title: Koalas and co
results.creator_credit: Rob McCubbin, Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development and Louise Jonas
results.brief_description: Non-narrated film which makes use of natural sound to observe some of the Australian animals that live in trees. Koalas, fruit bats, tree frogs and primitive looking lizards are observed in detailed close-ups, highlighting their adaptations to live in trees. Filmed at the Royal Melbourne Zoo, Melbourne Botanic Gardens and Healesville Sanctuary. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Koalas [Italian version]
results.creator_credit: John Morris, John Shaw and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian wildlife”.
The Koala’s popular image is as a sleepy, little creature. This film captures him in a more frolicsome mood - running, swimming and climbing. Active or drowsy, however, the Koala is always a popular subject. Also attmpts to correct some of the misconceptions about koalas. In Italian.

results.title: Koala
results.creator_credit: Bank of New South Wales and Harold J. Pollock
results.brief_description: A study in detail of the koala, a marsupial which inhabits the eastern and southern parts of the Australian continent. Shows mating habits, birth of the young, nurturing in the pouch and its later development outside the physical protection of the mother, though it still remains dependent upon her for survival. The koala is fully protected throughout Australia today but there is still a great need to set aside large areas of forest country to ensure its continued existence.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bank of New South Wales and Harold J. Pollock

results.title: Knud
results.creator_credit: Contemporary Films, Nuna Film and Jorgen Roos
results.brief_description: The story of Knud Rasmussen, an explorer from Denmark. Charts his private and public life on his expeditions across the North American Arctic. Commentary by Palle Koch.

results.title: Knowledge builders: our teeth
results.brief_description: Describes the growth and structure of teeth with particular emphasis on their organic vitality. Discusses reasons for oral hygiene.
